Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ahau56
Reviews.Content: Hi ! We had a lovely stay in this hotel for Easter 2012. The hotel staff were very friendly, the rooms were very clean. A cosy wintergarden for breakfast. The location of the hotel is perfect. We would love to stav here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Lisa E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautifully restored mansion. The landings of the floors are displayed a bit like a museum, with women's clothes and accessories. All of the room furniture is period appropriate. We had a stunning view of the blue mosque from our cozy room (small but adequate). Bathroom has been refurbished with modern fittings and is very clean, however, there is a bit of the old building toilet smell... which you cal let bother you or accept as part of the charm of staying in a historical mansion. It's not overwhelming, we just left the bathroom shut. I'm also sure ours was one of the worst since it was a top floor room. Since it's an old building there is a bit of noise transfer from the hall, so don't expect a silent room. Breakfast is plentiful and served in an open sunroom garden. We loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-located”
Reviews.Author: Sarah451985
Reviews.Content: We were nervous about staying here, given the mixed reviews the hotel has received online. However, we had a wonderful stay! Our garden room was very small, but beautifully decorated with classic furniture and wall hangings. Similarly, the wall hangings and framed tiles/pictures in the atriums of the hotel created a really quaint, Turkish feel. Even though our room was on the first floor and faced the street, we did not really have an issue with noise at night. The breakfast included coffee, juice, bread and cheese, and two different types of delicious pastries (one with apple/cinnamon and one with potato and cheese). The hotel was, also, incredibly well located--we could be at all the main sites within a few minutes of leaving the front door! However, because it is in such a tourist district, you have to walk a bit farther to find less tourist-y restaurants and things to do. Finally, the hotel staff did not seem that knowledgeable about things to do in Istanbul; for example, we were there over New Year's Eve and the staff did not know if and where there were fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotell with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia K
Reviews.Content: We we planed to spend new year in Istanbul I seach long for a nice cosy hotel and had high expectations when I booked this Erten Konak. It turned out to be a very charming hotel, nice decoration and a great location near bye The Blue Mosque. It is on a calm street nearby the The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, restaurants, shops and a couple of minutes walk from the tramb. Our room was on the top floor with a view over the roof tops and The Bosporen in the background. We had a deluxe room and I find the size of the room good, not small as I have seen other review write about. We were note disturbed of the wooden floor, mabye becauce we stayed on top floor. The staff at the hotel was very helpful. If a go back to Istanbul I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but charming”
Reviews.Author: Linteris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September. As stated in other reviews, some of the rooms are tiny - the photographs on the website make the rooms look larger than they are. Ours room was small and a little more elbow room would have been nice, but it was charming and clean; the bathroom was a good size and the shower worked well. We don't spend that much time in our room when we travel, so it wasn't a problem for us. The hotel has been restored, and you can tell that a lot of care was taken - the wooden floors were refinished, decorative ceiling moldings added and floral designs painted on the room doors. The staff was very friendly and answered all our questions. We even got to know the people in the little store on the corner, which sold bottled water for 50 cents. The hotel is centrally located a few blocks from Sultanahmet Square, convenient to everything. Even so, we did not find it noisy. When we left here to join our tour group at a larger hotel, I missed the charm of this one, although my husband liked the bigger room. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction depends on you”
Reviews.Author: Johann0909
Reviews.Content: Timber flooring and dry wall construction has its disadvantages, but we were quite satisfied with this hotel. The fact that it is centrally located is a huge advantage. If not this hotel, find one that is also in the old city. Easy to get to after a long night out. Our garden room was small and the shower cubicle tiny. However, very clean and breakfast was fine. I will easily go back to this hotel. Just a note: There are cheaper ways to travel to or from the airport. Use the metro and tram lines for under 2Euro per person compared to what hotels charge.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Website”
Reviews.Author: cambridgechica
Reviews.Content: Oh brother, where do I even begin? - Don't let the pretty pics on their website fool you. The hotel isn't as glamorous as they make it look. - According to their website, "this is a residence, which smells history abundantly..." Really? It certainly smells of something, alright! It's not a completely unpleasant smell, but it definitely has that old-building-with-old-facilities smell (which it probably is). I wished I had brought some air freshener. - Wake up call is utterly unreliable. On our first morning, the wake up call never rang. On the second morning, it was five minutes late. On the third morning--when we were leaving for the airport!!!--it was TWENTY FIVE minutes late. Thankfully, we learned not to rely on it, so we set the alarm on our cell phone. - Power outage at least 2x during our 3-nights stay. I wonder if it's a regular occurrence. - The air conditioning only worked sometimes. - Lastly, weird (and kind of shady) business practice. When we called to make last minute reservations, we were told that they were all booked. But a minute later, upon someone's suggestion, we were able to book via booking.com. We were told that this is a common practice among some hotels in Istanbul. They save some rooms open to hike up the price to someone walking in. (I really hope this isn't true.) The hotel certainly didn't look fully booked during our stay. Okay, it's not all that bad. - Good location. Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and all the major sites in Sultanahmet are just a few minutes away by foot. (Caveat: it's located in a small street that's kind of deserted and dark at night, so just be extra cautious.) - We got a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque from our room, though I'm sure not all rooms have that view. - The facilities were clean, despite the smell. - The staff was overall very hospitable. In summary, this hotel cost us the most throughout our stay in Turkey, and sadly, it was the worst. I'm sad we ended our vacation here.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Terribly noisy, tiny rooms - great location doesn't make up for it. Very deceiving website.”
Reviews.Author: Angelwings256
Reviews.Content: Despite its good location just a street away from the Blue Mosque, this hotel is extremely overpriced compared to others and is not accurately described on its website. We first tried to book the cheaper garden suite but they managed to give it to someone else leaving us with no choice but to book a deluxe room at 120 euros a night. We didn't want to pay this much but thought of it as a treat - we were looking forward to the sort of room you see on their website. Unfortunately the photos you see on there are very cleverly taken. There is barely enough room to walk around the bed, let alone put your cases anywhere. We also had no view whatsoever, just walls of other buldings about a metre away from our window - this is despite the website saying all of the rooms look out on to the sea or mosque - make sure you don't get room 204. Although if you strain your neck and look up you might just be able to see a little bit of sky to see if it's sunny or not. The worst flaw of this hotel however is the terrible noise from creaking floors. We expected some as it's an old building but it was beyond ridiculous. We had 3 very interrupted nights' sleep, mostly because the people above somehow managed to walk around their bed for hours at a time at any point in the night and as early as 6am. Don't expect a lie in if the people above are going for breakfast at 7. The creaking wouldn't have been half as bad if the vibrating ceiling from people walking above hadn't rattled the ornate light with every step. It was like kitchen plates being rubbed together constantly as it clanged about and it's not just minor creaking noise, it's full on banging and this from average sized people. It was like a herd of elephants and that's no exaggeration. At 1.30am this isn't what you want from a so called 4 star hotel. We complained but nothing was done, what could be done apart from asking the people to stop walking about at stupid times which didn't seem to be asked of them as we continued to lose sleep. We couldn't even rely on the tv to block out the noise as the signal was so poor and there was only one English channel anyway, BBC World, which you can only watch for so long before it starts repeating itself! We ended up having to catch up on sleep after the people above us had gone out for the day which meant we lost time in the city. Breakfast wasn't great either so we didn't even benefit from this being included in the price. If you wanted a meal in the so called restaurant it wasn't exactly a restaurant but the empty breakfast room. You had to go and find someone at reception to ask for food and I presume they then went and found someone to cook you something. On the positive, the decor is nice and traditional and the bathroom is great. Staff are friendly and rooms were cleaned well. Location is very good. All in all, don't believe anything shown or written on their website - the so called gardens are virtually non-existent and are simply walkthroughs. Again, the photos are very deceiving. This a very small but tall hotel, well decorated throughout but I would never risk having constant interrupted sleep when you only have a few days there, especially when there are equally as attractive places in the same area for a cheaper price. We feel well and truly robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mie_11
Reviews.Content: The plusses: The hotel has a very central location The rooms are lovely furnished and clean The staff was/ tried to be friendly but their English was very poor The negatives: The rooms are small, have very creaky floors and ours had a smelly bathroom. Breakfast was poor (milk and cheese had gone bad on 2 occasions) en there wasn't much choice. I would not recommend having lunch or dinner in the hotel either(we had a free voucher, but it was the worst meal we had during our entire stay)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly, well maintained, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: mhaines94108
Reviews.Content: Four nights of making love as quietly as possible! The walls and floors are thin in this beautiful, well-maintained hotel tucked behind the Blue Mosque. It is cute and charming, with unique Turkish flavor. There are many similarly unique small hotels in the area. This one is a block or two farther behind the Blue Mosque, a little farther from the restaurants, and definitely cheaper but still delivers high value. The breakfast buffet showed signs of the food being put out a few too many days in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money boutique hotel with an ethic Ottoman sence..."”
Reviews.Author: MaViDouk
Reviews.Content: Service was superb!! Hotelsâ€™ staff was extremely helpful at any time. The hotel itself was a wonderful experience! Small but beautifully decorated rooms, ottoman furniture and a sense of Ottoman Empireâ€™s best at all spaces. Best value for money hotel I have ever visited in Istanbul Extra tip: it is indeed also very romanticâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, but hotel not as described on the website.”
Reviews.Author: vicky055
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Erten Konak hotel in Istanbul. We have quite mixed feelings about the hotel, as there are some really good points, but also some bad points about it. On the positive side, the hotel provided a great pick up service and is a fantastic location for seeing all the main sights. The hotel is decorated beautifully and the price includes an average buffet breakfast. On the negative side the room we were initially given was tiny and quite tatty. There was no room to leave our cases and there was no room to walk around, as the bed took up 90% of the floor space. At the price we paid for the room and the way the rooms were described on the website we were really disappointed. Also the room was really warm and stuffy. We were willing to put up with the size of the room, but were unable to put up with the heat in the room (air conditioning wasnâ€™t working). We therefore asked to be moved to a different room, which we were eventually able to after two days. The new room was larger, but had an unbearably disgusting smell of drains in the bathroom. At this point we didn't dare to complain again, so we just put up with it. We were not really made to feel welcome and felt uncomfortable when for asking for anything. We booked this hotel as a treat and feel that we could have got a better hotel for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect location, decoration, breakfast, and above all the friendly faces of the staff people”
Reviews.Author: marshallsManchester
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful surprise with this hotel. We've never been to Istanbul, but had an idea on where to stay, so we chose it for its location and of course price. It's what I would call a boutique=hotel, so good taste on the decor, beautiful furniture and paintings on the walls, cozy rooms, with slippers and bath robes. The breakfast is amazing, from fresh fruits to exquisite cheeses, that good smelling bread, olives and whatsoever else you can't possibly eat it all. The staff is the most friendly and helpful you can find, always there for you. If you are going to Istanbul, stay at the Erten Konak, a walfing distance from the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Right next door to the Four Seasons. Enjoy it !!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice boutique hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: trolleypacker
Reviews.Content: I booked through booking.com and I paid a very good price for 2 nights in a tiny nice, well decorated room. We enjoyed very much our stay. Sophisticated and comfy place but not pretentious and excessive luxurious. clean and nice breakfast in the charming veranda. good location to visit the old part of instanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: LondonBonTraveller
Reviews.Content: The decor is really beautiful, we had a gorgeous, luxurious room with lovely furniture. However, we felt as a young couple we were unusual in staying there and that the staff weren't used to people who might want a lie in on their holiday. I'm not sure how many stars it is, although its advertised on splendia as 4 star. It definitely doesn't meet the standards of other hotels we've stayed in with this ranking. Our bedlinen had a very large hole in it and the cleaners didn't replace out towels. Also, there was no iron in the bedroom which was inconvenient. Also, it was advertised as having free wi fi but the signal was so weak that it didn't work in our room. We had been staying at another hotel before hand and had called into this hotel a few days before to book a cab to pick us up. We assume that they forgot as the cab never turned up and the man we had booked it from didn't refer to it once we got there. One incident that made us feel unwelcome in particular was that the cleaning ladies were very rude to us. My boyfriend had gone out in the morning time to the local shop and on returning found the two cleaning ladies camped outside our room (It was 11am) saying when were we going to be out of there because they wanted to finish. When you're spending well over Â£120 a night for a room this behaivour is hardly merited. After about another half an hour, we had a knock on our door, this time it was one of the hotel porters. He wanted to know when we were going out or if we wanted the cleaners. I found this very intrusive and rude. When we left a few minutes later the two ladies scowled at us as we left despite my boyfriend saying thank you and smiling at them. All in all it made us feel very uncomfortable. When we returned, nothing had been properly tidied and the towels and sheets had not been changed. I'd still recommend it to a friend as the design is so lovely and its location is good for seeing the old city and the other staff were pleasant but when I return to Istanbul I will be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of heaven in central Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bethandavies70
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel and were delighted. It is ideally located in a gorgeous part of Sultanahmet, quiet yet central. The decor is beautiful, the staff are very friendly and the service excellent. I travel often but have seldom found such a delightful hotel. I would have no hesitation in staying there again and recommending it to others

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, friendly, and a pleasant walk from great cultural sites...”
Reviews.Author: Mojofarm
Reviews.Content: The staff were quite nice, the location was snuggled in a friendly street, and short walks offered the Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace. The rooms are very small, but the Erten Konak makes up for this cramping of style, with friendliness and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoptravelfood
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Istanbul! Good deal of it goes to the charming small hotel with a perfect location. Everyone was telling that the best place to stay is the Taksim area because of the restaurants, shopping, nightlife & local colour. Yet chose a hotel in Sultanahmet where all the main sights are located including the bazaars and Turkish baths. Found fantastic Turkish restauranta near the hotel. Locals living in the wooden houses just across the street. Service in the hotel was very kind & helpful. Probably all the rooms are different. Had a small room with wooden floor (hate carpets!) on the 1st floor with 2 windows facing basicly nowhere, but that didn't bother. Everything was clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was functional. Friends had a biggerroom on the top floor with fantastic views to the Bosphorus. Buffet breakfast was nothing special, but ok. Excellent choice! Shoptravelfood Blogger

Reviews.Title: “It's a great choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Sasp20
Reviews.Content: We strongly recommend this hotel..everything were great!!The staff was very kind and helpful, the breakfast was delicious and the location was very nice!! It's a very good choice!! We liked so much than stayed one more night there!! SÃ¡ e LÃª

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Frecarpi83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days, in executive room, at first floor. The room isn't very big, but was very nice, and (most important) CLEAN, VERY CLEAN. The bed was very comfortable, the shower was big and with hydro. The room offers all facilities: minibar, bathrobe, hairdryer, slippers, tv and wireless. The breakfast was good with bread, eggs, cheese, ham, hand made jam, butter, fruit, corn flakes, orange juice, chocolate pie and more. The staff was very nice and the Hotel has a terrace where you can see the blue mosquee. But there's also a negative thing: the wooden floor was very noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to call home”
Reviews.Author: elyfretz
Reviews.Content: Quiet affordable boutique hotel with nice breakfast and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Erten Konak Hotel peaceful haven in Sulthanamet”
Reviews.Author: OBSERVER001
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel good location . Just avoid the fish restaurant on the corner something" fish house " bad food and an alarmingly high bill .

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Boutique Ottoman Hotel - wonderfully helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Moss
Reviews.Content: We were so glad that we chose the Erten Konak for our 2 night stay in Istanbul. ..Yes, the room was small but beautifully decorated and comfortable and with a close up view of the Blue mosque. The breakfast buffet was lavish and tea and coffee were available all day with afternoon tea at no extra cost. Management and staff were all extremely helpful and friendly assisting us with arrangements for our overnight bus trip to Capadoccia while we sipped apple tea and nibbled turkish delight. Selim we miss you - hope your English lessons are going well.

Reviews.Title: “Room was WAY too tiny!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flipper1968
Reviews.Content: There are better places! This is a beautiful hotel... but the rooms are too tiny!! I would recommend only if the person was open to sleeping in a closet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjm_14London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Erten Konak for the Easter long weekend and loved our stay at this hotel. The location is fantastic - right near the blue mosque and a very easy walk to all of the sights. The hotel is beautifully decorated both inside and out and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Istanbul and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: bearrobb
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique Hotel. More like staying with great friends in their beautiful Ottoman Home. Location is unbeatable. The staff goes above and beyond for any and all requests. For instance, I was to meet my spouse on January 1 but arrived on New Years Eve alone, they were concerned about my plans for the evening and insisted I spend the holiday celebrating with their family. It was so memorable and I was accepted as a long lost cousin. The only draw back would be the room size. It was quite small but very luxurious with a view to die for... Stay if you want an authentic experience and enjoy your new friends at the Erten Konak

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Slowhill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Erten Konak with my mother for four days in December. We were on holiday, so I was looking for something authentic and memorable, that's why we opted for a traditional Ottoman house. The hotel is tastefully decorated and is located in a quiet street next to the Blue Mosque. Some rooms actually face the Blue Mosque, and the view is impressive. The service is excellent, and the staff is very helpful. After several days you forget you're in a hotel, but rather like visiting good friends. Tea and coffee is free and available any time, as well as the selection of cakes, pastry ,and fruit. On the less optimistic note, some rooms are really small. In particular, the twin room we were staying at hardly had any space for suitcases. I would recommend this place only in case you are offered a large room, otherwise it's inconvenient. Also, access to higher floors is by spiral staircase only, so it's obviously not for elderly people to climb. The hotel is very new, and hopefully, with time it will only be getting better. It shows much promise, and has lots of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice but room not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: berurier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new, it opened at the end of august. The house is very nice, it's and old Ottoman wooden house which has been repared. The interior is as nice as outside, and all is decored with good taste. Staff is kind and helpfull. breakfast is very good, with fresh juices, choices of things to eat like bread, jam, cheese, jam, eggs, sausages, cakes, good crepes etc... But we had a disapointment. We booked via a site (booking.com). We were supposed to have a large room with large bed (like said in the description of the room I was supposed to have) . In fact we had a very small room (It was dikkicult to walk around, and our cases disturbed us) with a small bed (140 cm). I wanted to go at the reception to protest, but my girlfriend did not want to, as she doesn't not like to protest. Location is very good, in the heart of Sultanahmet. So i think that if you have the chance to get a normal room (not 6 m2 like ours !) with a normal bed, you should have a very good time here.
